transcript: i know that beat i know intimately especially i will not mourn the dead with murder gather my beloved near and our chanting will be dancing our humming i will dance and resist and dance and persist and dance this heartbeat is louder than death your war drum ain 't louder than this breath haaa what 's up ted people let me hear you make some i 've been wrong a lot lately like a lot so i couldn 't figure out i mean i 've been saying i 've been prepping what that means is prepping my outfit trying to figure out what i 'm coming behind and going in front of poetry does that so i am going to read a poem that was chosen just now but i 'm going to need you to just sit for like ten minutes and hold a woman who is not here hold her now with you you don 't need to say her name out loud you can just hold her are you holding her this is break clustered all holy history banned unwritten books predicted the future projected the past but my head unwraps whose son shall it be our boys ' deaths galvanize we cherish corpses we mourn women complicated profits made prophets ignored war and tooth enameled salted lemon childhoods all colors run none of us solid don 't look for shadow behind me i carry it within sickness health tender i think now i never was pure before form i was storm one woman one woman feeds on trash one woman never did where do placed where they 're not from don 't want to be missed faced with absence we mourn each one or we mean nothing at all my spine curves spiral precipice running to and running from human beings cluster bombs left behind do not fear what has blown up if you must fear the unexploded
